unnormalised: Okay, so I keep seeing this question pop up: "Is AI actually useful in India?" and tbh, the answer is a big, fat YES! It's not just some sci-fi buzzword, you know? We're already seeing it everywhere, from agriculture to healthcare. Think about it – farmers in Punjab using AI-powered apps to predict the best time to sow their crops. That's real impact, folks! And in healthcare, AI's helping doctors in places like AIIMS diagnose diseases faster using image recognition, like spotting TB from x-rays, which is a huge deal.

unnormalised: Then there's the whole e-commerce scene. All those recommendations you see on Flipkart or Amazon? That's AI working its magic. It's analyzing your past purchases and suggesting stuff you might like. Plus, customer service is getting smarter too. Many companies are now using AI-powered chatbots to answer your questions 24/7, even on a Sunday at 3 AM. It's pretty convenient when you need help with an order late at night.

unnormalised: But, yeah, there are challenges. Data privacy is a big one, especially with Aadhaar and all. And we need to make sure AI is being used ethically and responsibly. Also, there's the skills gap. We need more people trained in AI to really take advantage of its potential. IITs and other engineering colleges need to up their game and offer more specialized courses, maybe even short-term certifications.
